titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3003, NO SANCTUARY FOR CRIMINALS ACT

name.namePart: Committee on Education and the Workforce

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3003, NO SANCTUARY FOR CRIMINALS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 111

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: No Sanctuary for Criminals Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 414, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3003) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify provisions relating to assistance by States, and political subdivision of States, in the enforcement of Federal immigration laws, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 190 noes, Roll No. 332, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 331.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: No Sanctuary for Criminals Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 414, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3003) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to modify provisions relating to assistance by States, and political subdivision of States, in the enforcement of Federal immigration laws, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 190 noes, Roll No. 332, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 331.

titleInfo.title: PROTECTING ACCESS TO CARE ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROTECTING ACCESS TO CARE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 111

congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.
So the motion to recommit was rejected.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Protecting Access to Care Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1215, to improve patient access to health care services and provide improved medical care by reducing the excessive burden the liability system places on the health care delivery system, by a recorded vote of 218 ayes to 210 noes, Roll No. 337.

extension.searchTitle: ROBERT EMMET PARK ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 111

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure. Consideration began Tuesday, June 27th.<P/>H.R. 1500, to redesignate the small triangular property located in Washington, DC, and designated by the National Park Service as reservation 302 as ``Robert Emmet Park'', by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 423 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 338.
